Precerebellar nucleus.EditorialNote: According to Brain Info, Carpenter includes only the nuclei of the hindbrain (http://braininfo.rprc.washington.edu/centraldirectory.aspx?ID
Precerebellar nucleus.Definition: Neuron population that send all or nearly all of its efferents to the cerebellum, including cell populations in the spinal cord, the funicular nuclei, the nucleus solitarius, the principal nucleus of the trigeminal nerve, the locus coeruleus, the inferior olive and the pontine nucleus in mammals (Butler and Hodos, Comparative Vertebrate Neuroanatomy, 2nd ed., 2005, pg. 256.)
